programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: The Landrys race to tag out at the end of the season, but they have company, as RJ and Jay Paul invade their territory looking to tag out themselves.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey tries not to be a Scrooge when two first editions of A Christmas Carol appear in the shop, while Rick is rocked when a meteorite drops in.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee checks out two classic pinball machines, while Rick turns his attention to a carrier pigeon capsule from the First World War and decides to take up boxing.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team repair a 1900s meat slicer and a 1950s stamp vending machine.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick works on a 1940s dog-tag maker, and the team restores a toy horse from the 1950s to its former glory.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: A lorry loaded with lumber drives off a cliff while swerving to avoid a boulder. Jamie's team attends the scene and struggles to prevent the vehicle falling further towards a railway line. Plus, heavy rescue is called when a trailer loaded with millions of plastic beads crashes.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: The Spider-Man co-creator meets a man who describes his body as unbreakable and attempts an amazing physical feat to prove his strength.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The puzzling murder of Beverly Eller, found dead in her home in 1988. For years the crime went unsolved, until the discovery of evidence linking an unlikely suspect to the crime.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams search for the most profitable spare parts of quirky vehicles, including campervans and VW Beetles. Narrated by John Challis.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Gold family and its employees are ready to haggle as members of the public continue to bring in their unique items in the hope of raising some cash.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer wants to sell a coat allegedly made of rare monkey fur. Seth is tempted to make a purchase that could prove beneficial to the finances of the business.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank pick through the junk at an airport and are tempted by vintage pedal cars. However, they find the owner will not part with them easily.

programme.title: Bible Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Investigating Biblical prophecies, which are said to be messages and warnings sent from God, asking what they really foretell and if they could predict mankind's future.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team from UFO Magazine examines the most compelling examples of UFO relics available, such as a unique and other-worldly piece of metal in Missouri.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and the team repair a 1900s meat slicer and a 1950s stamp vending machine.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick works on a 1940s dog-tag maker, and the team restores a toy horse from the 1950s to its former glory.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys check out a Second World War Morse Code reader and a letter written by John Quincy Adams. Plus, Corey bravely takes over the annual Independence Day barbecue.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick sizes up a signed print of a famous Ansel Adams photograph, and the shop attempts to cash in on a 1791 one cent coin.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy tries to keep his winning streak going, while Darrell and Rene play mind games with each other. Jarrod and Brandi visit a crime scene and travel back in time.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi is intent on closing the Long Beach store, but Jarrod is determined to save it by scoring more lockers. Ivy tries to intimidate other buyers, while Darrell gets the shock treatment.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Gold family and its employees are ready to haggle as members of the public continue to bring in their unique items in the hope of raising some cash.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer wants to sell a coat allegedly made of rare monkey fur. Seth is tempted to make a purchase that could prove beneficial to the finances of the business.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths must create a signature blade using a randomly chosen mystery technique. After a brutal round of testing, only two will reproduce a Japanese Naginata.

programme.title: America's Book of Secrets
programme.desc: An insight into what the US government is doing to protect its people, from atomic attacks to cyber warfare and deadly airborne viruses.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates eyewitness reports of cattle slaughter allegedly caused by UFOs, and are hot on the trail of a recent mutilation case.

programme.title: Bible Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Examining if the Bible could contain contradictions, or hidden meanings, that challenge mankind's beliefs about what is right and wrong regarding sexuality.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The toss of a coin determines the value of a gold chain Les believes is out of fashion. A customer is upset when Seth prevents her from using the staff toilets.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman rejects custom-made earrings, as she thought the term diamond cut meant they were diamonds. Seth puts his faith into younger sellers, believing they can outperform Les.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the King of Montebello
programme.desc: Ivy hires someone to look after his shop, while Jarrod and Brandi split up for auctions in Montebello.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: For a Good Time, Call Ivy
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi are under financial pressure, and fear they will lose one of their shops if they do not make a profitable bid soon.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: Paul sets out in his own boat after having been fired by Dave, roping in his fishing legend brother to help him plan his revenge on his former employer.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: Part one of two. Experts predict what would happen if there was a repeat of the 1906 earthquake that shook San Francisco in 1906. The original disaster is studied for clues.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy tries to keep his winning streak going, while Darrell and Rene play mind games with each other. Jarrod and Brandi visit a crime scene and travel back in time.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi is intent on closing the Long Beach store, but Jarrod is determined to save it by scoring more lockers. Ivy tries to intimidate other buyers, while Darrell gets the shock treatment.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Christmas special of the quiz show from 2006 in which host Stephen Fry decorates the Tree of Knowledge. Joining him are regular contributor Alan Davies, as well as guests Jo Brand, Dara O Briain and Rich Hall. As usual the questions are so difficult that points are awarded for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Nikki Fox, Miles Jupp, Nish Kumar and Joe Lycett to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Adrian Edmondson, Claude Littner, Cariad Lloyd and Jordan Stephens to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig considers the subjects of pain and punishment, with guests Jimmy Carr, Lee Mack and Alice Levine joining regular Alan Davies on the panel.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: Gail and Todd prepare to deliver Erica's baby, while Phil and Jasper make a chilling find.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: Recognising the threat of radioactive fallout from the power plant, the gang sets sail for Mexico.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James charts the history of 4x4 vehicles from the jeeps of the Second World war onwards, revealing how they rose in popularity in everyday use and in rallies. He explores the rivalry between Land Rover and Land Cruiser, and puts some classic vehicles through their paces by driving up Mount Fuji and through the Mojave desert.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The items Mike and Frank bought in Europe arrive in the US, and the guys also visit a vintage car company.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: In the penultimate episode, an unlikely pairing enrages bidders in Birmingham, Linda is determined to keep her game face on despite Dan's jibes, and Nat and John are at each other's throats. Sean Kelly hosts.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sparks are flying in Royston, Hertfordshire, and not just amongst the bidders as the contents of a bin goes up in smoke, and a mystery object under tarp causes a cat-fight. Sean's flying skills are put to the test and Nat and John take a gamble on a double unit - but will it pay off?.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank get off the road for a behind-the-scenes look back at their most memorable moments together, featuring their dustiest adventures and most amazing discoveries.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: There are more problems for Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz as they attempt to retrieve an iconic American sports car that is so rare they have never even heard of it.

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James looks at some of the advances in motoring that never caught on, revealing how the petrol engine came to dominate in the 20th century, while concepts for jet engines and steam power fell by the wayside. He also drives an amphibious car and an electric scooter, and takes a ride in the world's fastest driverless car.

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Rhod Gilbert and Greg Davies negotiate a variety of unusual hazards as they travel through Nepal, a country with one of the world's highest rates of road traffic accidents. Frequent floods and landslides mean car journeys are often fraught with danger, and matters are not helped by the varied states of Nepalese roads, which range from urban highways to crumbling mountain passes.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The hosts bid to prove that cars can be art by filling a gallery in Middlesbrough with motoring-related works, including a few creations of their own. They also resort to unusual promotional techniques to attract more visitors to their exhibition. Back on the track, Jeremy Clarkson tests British supercar the Noble M600. Jenson Button drives the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Bryan Sr and Joel brave the British Columbia backwoods to save a historic cabin, and Beat cooks up an outdoor log kitchen. Meanwhile, Peter builds a dream retreat.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: John Heussi and his team work on a high-performance BMW 330, the Interceptor, while a shortage of staff sees Dave manning the phones.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson spares no expense when he tests the BMW X6. James May joins Margaret Calvert, one of Britain's road-sign designers, to test-drive the Vauxhall Insignia VXR, and Richard Hammond tries out a Â£340,000 Lexus supercar. Plus, musician Seasick Steve is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall visits Fort Worth, Texas, where he takes on a monster pancake challenge, a painful rodeo test, and local delicacy calves' testes in the world's largest Honky Tonk venue.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie hits San Antonio to sample the finest Tex-Mex food and a gigantic chicken fried steak - with no chicken. He also tests whether he has the moves for TV show Ninja Warrior.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Denise Lewis, Richard Osman, Robert Rinder and Katherine Ryan to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack return with previously unseen material from the latest run of the comedy panel show. Featuring appearances by guests including David Baddiel, Ed Balls, Jo Brand, Steve Davis, Susie Dent, Ade Edmondson, Sheila Hancock, Stephen Mangan, Bob Mortimer, Ore Oduba, Anita Rani, Fay Ripley, Stacey Solomon, Jordan Stephens, Claudia Winkleman and Kimberly Wyatt.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Christmas special from 2004, with Alan Davies, Rich Hall, Mark Steel and Phill Jupitus facing the questions. As ever, host Stephen Fry will only award points for answers he finds interesting.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Phill Jupitus, Cally Beaton and Rhod Gilbert join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an unconventional look at a potpourri of topics, while facing some impossible questions. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister loses Rimmer in a game of poker to a group of biologically engineered life forms, while Kryten and Cat become quantum entangled and do everything in perfect unison. Comedy series, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie, Robert Llewellyn and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister experiences romantic difficulties when he receives a letter from an ex-lover, and finds himself in a love triangle between Snack Dispensers 23 and 34. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Robert Llewellyn and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The Dwarfers face disaster when they are surrounded by a Simulant Death Ship and a fleet of Annihilators while hiding in an asteroid, and it is up to Arnold J Rimmer to save them. Comedy series, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the US navy's most advanced nuclear submarine - which can remain underwater for months at a time - examining the previous vessels that influenced it.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.sub-title: The Lost Viking Fleet of Roskilde
programme.desc: The remains of a fleet of Viking boats, and the modern historians attempting to recreate them.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Dag Bromberg: A City in the Forest
programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. On the fourth leg of his journey across the continent, Griff travels across Namibia in the south-west, experiencing luxury camping, encountering cheetahs, and visiting 1,000-foot sand dunes.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Deadliest Crash: Disaster at Le Mans
programme.desc: Documentary examining what caused Pierre Levegh's Mercedes to crash into the crowd during the 1955 Le Mans 24-hour race, killing more than 80 people - an accident that remains the worst in the history of motor racing. Among the theories discussed are the use of untested technologies by the car's manufacturers, the addition of a lethal fuel additive and allegations of reckless driving by future Formula One world champion Mike Hawthorn, who won the race with Jaguar team partner Ivor Bueb. Narrated by Jack Deam.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: On the final leg of his journey, the comedian crosses 1,000 miles of South Africa, reaching the most southerly passenger railway station on the continent. Heading to Johannesburg, he reveals how the city has benefited from the scale of gold-mining in the area. Later on, he takes to the skies in a light aircraft for a bird's-eye view of one of South Africa's largest ostrich farms, and catches one of the world's most luxurious trains for a seven-hour ride to Cape Town, before reaching the coastal settlement of Simon's Town.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: The experts head to a field in south Oxfordshire where significant findings were made by an inquisitive PhD student half a century ago, including a mosaic and the stone walls of a former Roman building. Tony Robinson and the crew examine aerial pictures showing clear building lines in the ground, and speak to the current landowner, a farmer who continues to uncover bricks and tiles. They try to evaluate the building's purpose and how the Thames may have shifted the remains over the course of two millennia.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team search for the remains of a Norman castle in Dundrum, Co Down, one of Northern Ireland's most picturesque counties, exploring a territory established by renegade knight John de Courcy in the 12th century against the orders of King John. The castle was later rebuilt, and much of its replacement is still standing, but the experts are convinced that some of what remains dates from de Courcy's time - and discover that it may go back even further.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.desc: A look at the discovery of various sites where Vikings had buried treasure, examining why they did it and where the loot came from originally.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team search for the remains of a Norman castle in Dundrum, Co Down, one of Northern Ireland's most picturesque counties, exploring a territory established by renegade knight John de Courcy in the 12th century against the orders of King John. The castle was later rebuilt, and much of its replacement is still standing, but the experts are convinced that some of what remains dates from de Courcy's time - and discover that it may go back even further.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how fleas are able to jump great distances for their size and attempts to discover how fast a cheetah can run.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores animals that have developed tool-making skills to help them survive, including orangutans and crows.

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores how insects compensate for their small size by banding together in vast numbers. He reveals that the operations of many of these societies are so finely tuned they appear to work as a single entity. Footage shows how African termite mounds act as huge ventilation systems of such sophistication that humans are only now beginning to unravel the mechanics of the structure.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The extension of the Panama Canal to accommodate the world's largest ships, which drew inspiration from the work of 17th-century engineer Hugues Cosnier.

programme.title: Viking Dead
programme.desc: A look at the discovery of various sites where Vikings had buried treasure, examining why they did it and where the loot came from originally.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: The engineering breakthroughs that allow trains to go faster than ever thought possible, including technology that allows trains to navigate the winding mountains of Spain at speed.

programme.title: Churchill's Secret Son
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of Tipperary-born businessman and Conservative cabinet minister Brendan Bracken, who became Winston Churchill's right-hand man during the Second World War by opposing efforts to appease Adolf Hitler. The film considers the possibility of a biological connection between the two men.

programme.title: The Good Nazi
programme.desc: The story of Major Karl Plagge, a high-ranking Nazi officer who risked his own life to save hundreds of people, in a story reminiscent of Schindler's List.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: An examination of how Leon Degrelle and an array of Finns, Estonians and fellow Belgians joined German volunteer brigades to hold off the Red Army on the Eastern front during the Second World War and enabled 56,000 men to escape.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The extension of the Panama Canal to accommodate the world's largest ships, which drew inspiration from the work of 17th-century engineer Hugues Cosnier.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. A nanny working for a Russian oligarch is killed in a botched assassination attempt, a bloody shootout that also leaves an unknown hitman dead. As the team joins forces with young DI Sarah Parks to ascertain the identity of the dead would-be assassin, further questions begin to mount - who would want the businessman dead, and why? Two-part story, starring Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern, with Lauren O'Neil, Pippa Haywood and Shaun Dingwall.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Although she and Dale are rescued from the Radfords' murderous clutches, Kerry's problems are just beginning as Gina gets wind of her undercover mission and vows to end her career in the force. A heated argument between Adam and Rob ends with the latter being issued a formal warning, and Sam fears the worst when her teenage daughter Abi goes missing. A paedophilia case reopens old wounds for Terry - but can he explain to a shocked Ramani why he accessed a child pornography website?.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh creates havoc for Charlie when he reveals her secret talent. Penny's first day back in Whyhope is headed for disaster until she joins forces with Hugh.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh clashes with Penny's new boyfriend, Meryl plays dirty to win the re-count of the Mayoral election, and Ajax does work experience in the hospital.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward presents from Birmingham's Uplands Allotment, where an array of unusual plants and vegetables are on display.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice receives news that will change her life for ever, while Evie is introduced to impoverished painter Daniel Page.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy remains in hospital, and his friends are told that he may never recover his sight, while Marsha Stubbs' involvement with a local businessman leads to a brush with the law.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The regiment's tour in Germany is cut short. Meanwhile, a prank in the Officer's Mess causes trouble for Tucker. Starring Robson Green and Rob Spendlove.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: A flamboyant new plastic surgeon joins the team, earning Will's disapproval almost immediately, and attempts to pay a shocked Tricia for helping him. Connie organises an evening of cricket as a team bonding exercise - but in her absence, Ric proposes they just get drunk instead and takes the opportunity to question Owen on his intentions toward Diane. Donna fails to pay the rent yet again, but this time Lisa has had enough and orders her out immediately.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Although she and Dale are rescued from the Radfords' murderous clutches, Kerry's problems are just beginning as Gina gets wind of her undercover mission and vows to end her career in the force. A heated argument between Adam and Rob ends with the latter being issued a formal warning, and Sam fears the worst when her teenage daughter Abi goes missing. A paedophilia case reopens old wounds for Terry - but can he explain to a shocked Ramani why he accessed a child pornography website?.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: As all attempts to locate Abi Nixon prove fruitless, Sam begins to panic - could her daughter have been abducted, committed suicide or even faked her own death? Terry hands in his resignation to Ramani and wrestles with demons from his past as his brother Ben confesses that he too had been sexually abused as a child. Yvonne gives troubled teenager Shirley a stern lecture after she steals money from Dean, only to bite her tongue on learning the wayward youngster has been diagnosed HIV-positive.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nick confesses to Dot that he murdered Eddie Royle. Dot calls the police and Nick gets taken away. The whole Square are waiting for news of Clyde.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pete has plans for the Fowlers to celebrate Christmas in style - but it's not the style Arthur has in mind.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: With Baz on maternity leave, Kate and Charlie offer Sam Colloby a job. A man blames a noisy neighbour for keeping him awake at night, resulting in him falling asleep at the wheel and being injured as a consequence. Two men attend a roleplay meeting, but chaos ensues during a pretend fight when one bites off the other's forefinger.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A virtuoso violinist baffles Lovejoy by asking him to help pull off an elaborate con involving a fake Stradivarius - so he enlists an expert to find out what is going on. Whimsical drama, starring Ian McShane.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim sets out to prove the French police were wrong to accuse a man of murdering his wife. John Nettles plays the Jersey detective.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Joe Maplin's model volcano erupts during Ted's act, leaving him with no choice but to organise a party to sabotage the explosive culprit. Classic comedy, starring Paul Shane, Su Pollard and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Young Mr Grace instructs everyone to wear fancy dress in the run-up to Christmas, turning the departments into fairy-tale grottos. Festive edition of the department store comedy from 1975, with Harold Bennett, John Inman and Mollie Sugden.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Rene finds himself involved in multiple murder plots when the universally unpopular General Von Klinkerhoffen decides to become more involved in controlling the district.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The detective looks into the suspicious death of an old friend and informant. The investigation leads him to the local police station, where it becomes clear the officers are hiding something - and to complicate matters, the disappearance of a teenage boy is also linked to the case. Crime drama, with Martin Shaw, Lee Ingleby and guest stars Neil Pearson, Dean Lennox Kelly and Mark Benton.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Double bill. A rising star in the Essex police force is found beaten and shot in his burnt-out car in what proves to be an emotional case for his colleagues. The team helps DCI Jim Sullivan, the detective charged with bringing the killer to justice, and it isn't long before suspicion falls on Dean Fallon - a local drug dealer and the son of a known crime boss. But when he proves to have a solid alibi, the investigation shifts closer to home. Starring Emilia Fox and David Caves, with James Alexandrou and Jason Watkins.

programme.title: Bancroft
programme.desc: Detective Superintendent Bancroft is faced with a blast from the past that brings events from 1990 to the surface, and Katherine wrestles with new information that she is uncovering. Elsewhere, Daanish fulfils his part of the deal, and Anya makes a surprising visits to an old friend. Starring Sarah Parish, Faye Marsay and Amara Karan.

programme.title: Stephen Fry in Central America
programme.desc: Stephen's travels continue in Costa Rica, where he encounters poison-dart frogs and falls in love with a baby sloth at a biological research station. But he soon finds there is more to the country than conservation and eco-tourism as he ascends volcanoes, descends white-water rivers and experiences the passion of a football derby in the capital of San Jose. He then crosses over into Panama for the final leg of his trip, witnessing giant leatherback turtles coming ashore to lay their eggs and learning how to dredge the canal in Panama City.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Judge Rinder

programme.title: This Morning

programme.title: Loose Women

programme.title: STV News and Weather

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson is joined by antiques dealers Tony Geering, James Layte, Corrie Jeffrey and Alison Chapman in Scarborough, North Yorkshire, to help members of the public sort the treasures from their trash. Tony blows someone else's trumpet, James gets danced out of his dosh, Alison drops thousands on a claret jug, while Corrie gets her hand on a sparkling solitaire ring.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Host Sanjeev Bhaskar invites four new contestants to accumulate big cash totals by answering super quick-fire easy money questions. However, in order to take home that cash, they must survive The Switch, a series of three super hard multiple-choice questions that each has only one incorrect choice.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Bradley Walsh in which six contestants battle it out across a series of fast-paced question rounds where the players must actively try to sabotage their opponents by beating them to the buzzer and trapping them out of the game. In the final round, the person who has earned the most cash will go head to head against the rest of the group to try to take their winnings home.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather

programme.title: Emmerdale

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Robert's court hearing is delayed when new information comes to light, and Gary gets wind of Derek's plot to sell the factory. Meanwhile, Roy attempts to make peace with Nina.

programme.title: Hayman's Way
programme.desc: The best of David Hayman's travels across Scotland, featuring spectacular scenery, fascinating facts, rich mythology and some extraordinary characters.

programme.title: Coronation Street at Christmas
programme.desc: A look at the rich seam of Weatherfield's archive to showcase the stories that have entertained millions over the festive season for almost six decades - from weddings and babies to flings and fights, not forgetting those Christmas dinner-disasters and poignant goodbyes. Contributors including Barbara Knox, Chris Gascoyne, Jane Danson, William Roache, Sue Nicholls, Simon Gregson, Jack P Shepherd, Helen Flanagan, Thelma Barlow and Julie Goodyear share their memories of watching numerous, big Christmas storylines. Narrated by Sue Johnston.

programme.title: Ball & Boe: A Very Merry Christmas
programme.desc: After the huge success of their previous albums and sold-out tours, Michael Ball and Alfie Boe reunite for a festive night of music. Showcasing both their unique blend of extraordinary talent and infectious humour, the duo perform exciting new material alongside some Christmas favourites, as well as singing with special guests Shirley Bassey, Luke Evans and Gregory Porter.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The construction of the world's most powerful locomotive, how cows' milk is turned into clotted cream, and the crafting of a boomerang from a piece of wood.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a G Wagen, a popular German 4x4. Mechanic Edd China spruces it up with a 2012 front end and rear lights, but it may not be enough for them to turn a profit.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: Aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Phill Jupitus and Andy Parsons, the host supervises a battle between the Queen's Park Cafe from Glasgow and the Earl Haig from London.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A sinkhole swallows an entire neighbourhood, a speedboat crashes at 140mph, a plane ices over at 18,000ft and a huge explosion destroys a chemical plant.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A factory fire, a 135mph motorcycle crash, how a nine-storey building collapsed in Russia, and the explosion of a Titan rocket. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: Beavers cause problems by damaging trees, while Bobby and his crew are under pressure due to high wood demand and low timber stocks.

programme.title: Overhaulin' Chronicles
programme.desc: Chip Foose and a team of mechanics transform a US Air Force serviceman's 1963 Ford Nova.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The methods used by nuclear submarine crews to extinguish on-board fires, and the role of crash-test dummies in making motoring safer. Plus, the methods which allow the growing of perfect fruit and vegetables.

programme.title: Blowing Up History
programme.desc: The documentary series switches focus from ancient civilisations to more modern periods, investigating the secrets Victorian architects hid within the Palace of Westminster.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Alaskan king crab fishing fleet risks heavy storms to continue the dangerous pursuit of its valuable prey. The Rollo's GPS malfunctions in blizzard conditions, but the crew of the Time Bandit enjoy more success.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Rookies' relationship is on the rocks as they battle their biggest claim yet as well as each other. With two partners working at different speeds, there's a fight brewing.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Turbo is fighting to stay on track and on schedule to complete a marathon trek home. Meanwhile, in Tasmania, Euan is hitching a ride to deliver a volatile road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Sales supremo Mike Brewer has always wanted to have an old Caterham in the workshop, but mechanic Edd China decides to take a risk by painting it a shocking colour.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Four sisters seek car restorer Wayne Carini's advice about what to do with their father's 1939 BMW 328.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini attempts to auction off a number of different vehicles to help him in his quest to obtain a 1911 Winton 17b.

programme.title: Blowing Up History
programme.desc: Teams of scientists and archaeologists aim to unlock the secrets behind the construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza, one of the few surviving monuments of the ancient world.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: It seems it's the last chance for the Rookies' partnership. Meanwhile, the Cooke brothers contend with broken hoses and breakdowns in their quest to strike it rich.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Aleutian Ballad is left without power after being hit by an 80-metre wave during a storm. Meanwhile, the Maverick is in trouble after an inspection by the coastguard and the Northwestern's success is cut short by a problem with one of the hydraulic lifts.

programme.title: Treasure Quest
programme.desc: The Odyssey crew learns the recovered cannons are from HMS Victory, the flagship before Nelson's vessel of the same name.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits some family-run businesses in Lincolnshire and Norfolk in the hope of finding rare and unusual antiques that have never been put on sale before.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Steve Graham fights torrid weather conditions as he tries to create a road train, while Yogi's truck breaks down on a cross-country journey.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a G Wagen, a popular German 4x4. Mechanic Edd China spruces it up with a 2012 front end and rear lights, but it may not be enough for them to turn a profit.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Rookie Justin struggles to get his 20-tonne excavator across an extremely busy highway. Elsewhere, Opal Queen Kelly tackles a new challenge with a new partner.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: When other businesses move with the times, Drew Pritchard sees a chance to buy their unwanted stuff. In Essex, he finds a rare 1930s desk from a closing department store.

programme.title: The Unexplained Files
programme.sub-title: Peruvian Alien Skull and Baltic Sea UFO
programme.desc: A tiny skeleton defies medical explanation in Peru, and this programme investigates if it is a missing link in human evolution or proof of extra-terrestrial contact.

programme.title: Alien Encounters
programme.desc: More hybrids connect to the quantum computer, and the combined brainpower is able to crunch unprecedented data and calculate the future - including weather and health.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how sardines are fished and processed. Plus, the manufacture of ejector seats and Piaggio scooters.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The production of clogs, pasties and how planes are painted.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: Detectives, friends and family reveal the twists and turns that led to tragedy, and where it all went wrong - revealing the 10 steps to murder..

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How arson investigators gather physical evidence and mount undercover and sting operations to crack insurance torchings and instances of murder.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of Maurice Byrd, who was shot dead in his home. Security footage revealed he had many visitors before his body was discovered.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of 34-year-old Susan Casey. The mother-of-four's body was found floating in the Yellowstone River in May 2008, but the autopsy report concluded that she had been strangled. The investigation went cold for a few years until her ex-husband Walter Larson was arrested.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: An investigation into a series of armed robberies at gambling houses, including the MGM Grand Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas, which led to the arrest of a recently paroled man.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: A heat-exhausted domestic rabbit is abandoned in a car park, but proves tricky to catch. Investigator Mark persuades the owner of six underfed dogs to give them more food.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown feels the pressure when he comes to the aid of a distressed Sumatran tiger with a tooth problem.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: A Thorn in the Bride's Side
programme.desc: A beauty queen visits the shop hoping to find a dress she loves and her mother-in-law approves of. Another customer has to deal with an opinionated friend.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Cynthia's veil clashes with her dress, causing mayhem, while Passant is running out of time with a limited selection of outfits.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: A Dress with a Fighting Chance
programme.desc: A former soldier stands up to family and friends regarding her wedding dress, while a bride picks a gown in honour of her godfather.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Danni Dusek helps her friend's cat that keeps fighting with its neighbour. Meanwhile, Dr Peter Ricci struggles to get close to Lottie the ferocious and frightened Chihuahua.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: It takes a court warrant and police back-up before a group of horses can be removed from its owner, and a litter of Rottweiler puppies is rescued.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Animal cruelty investigator Ernie Angerstein makes his way to the suburbs and rescues a newborn kitten that was entombed behind a brick wall.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a tip in Altrincham, Greater Manchester - an old leather sofa, a Victorian cabinet and an Arts and Crafts-style bench.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How science is helping police establish links between contract killers and their employers.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Idaho roofer and avid hunter Jeramy Burt, who vanished in February 2007 shortly after telling his ex-wife he intended to seek a new life. Several months later, his car was found torched in a remote desert, but he had taken no other personal items with him other than his mobile phone.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Summer and Joseph McStay, who vanished from their home San Diego, California, with their two children in February 2010, leaving their pets and possessions behind. It transpired the pair were being chased by various debt collection agents and CCTV footage suggested they had crossed into Mexico. Subsequent to this documentary's first airing, their bodies were recovered from a shallow grave in the Californian desert, though the identity of their killers remains unknown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Having already tried on 65 traditional white dresses, Lauren is relieved when a pink gown finally catches her eye, but her father might prefer her to keep on looking.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Kelli seeks a Scarlett O'Hara-inspired dress, but her mother-in-law is determined to see her in a ball gown, so they may well leave the bridal salon empty-handed.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride happy to simply try dresses on is confronted with the reality of actually selecting a gown, while another customer is caught in a motherly crossfire.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: The mother of a bride-to-be tries to make her daughter feel guilty, while another mum refuses to relent on her love of a ballgown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Cassie tries to build bridges between her two best friends, who have hated each other since the day they met.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Amber and Ajeshia struggle to reach a compromise on the necklines of their bridesmaid dresses.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: Say Yes to the Dress: Best Bits
programme.desc: An exclusive sneak peek at events coming up in the new series for Randy and the bridal team at Kleinfeld's Bridal in Manhattan.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a remote salvage yard near Bournemouth, Dorset, modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard is drawn to a bathing beauty. Later, he visits an exclusive B&B in Yorkshire.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms items reclaimed from a tip in Altrincham, Greater Manchester - an old leather sofa, a Victorian cabinet and an Arts and Crafts-style bench.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Catching up with Angel, whose knee pain threatens her future, and Charity, who is pursuing her old goals again after post-surgery complications.

programme.title: Conviction
programme.desc: Recounting the case of ABC Australia employee Jill Meagher, who was abducted while walking along Melbourne's Sydney Road.and killed by known sex offender Adrian Bayley. This documentary follows the timeline of the Irish-born 29-year-old's disappearance in September 2012, husband Tom's anxious wait for news, and how homicide detectives brought Bayley to justice.

programme.title: The Coroner: I Speak for the Dead
programme.desc: Coroner Graham Hetrick recalls the discovery of the mutilated body of 38-year-old Jimmy Felder in his attic bedroom, and a rage found to be dangerously close to home.

programme.title: Katie Price: My Crazy Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Katie accepts an award in Dublin, tensions mount in her love life. With the prospect of bankruptcy looming, she recruits expert help to control her spending.
